org.jpws.data

Class Options

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jpws.data.Options

  • public class Options
extends java.lang.Object
    Static singleton class to provide and persistently store program options.

    This class implements the PersistentOptions interface although the static methods don't allow its declaration.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static byte[] randomSeed 
      static boolean wasReset

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public static void init(org.jpws.pwslib.data.ContextFile file)
        Initialises this service with attempting to load the parameter file. If the parameter file cannot be opened, a standard file is assumed instead.
        Parameters:
        file - specifies the JPWS options file to load; may be null

      • reset

        public static void reset()
        This resets Options to the default values.

        Saves the actual content of these options to a persistent file.

        Throws:

        Returns:

      • getBounds

        public static java.awt.Rectangle getBounds(java.lang.String token)
        Returns the mapped bounds object (e.g. for a window) or null if this option is undefined.
        Parameters:
        token - the option name
        Returns:
        Rectangle specifying position and size of a window
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if parameter is null
        Since:
        0-5-0

      • setStringList

        public static boolean setStringList(java.lang.String name,
                                    java.util.List<java.lang.Object> ls)
        Stores a list of string representations of objects in options. The toString() method is used on each object to derive its representation value. (NOTE: this is not necessarily a serialization of objects themselves!)
        Parameters:
        name - String name of the list to store
        ls - List list of objects, use null to clear
        Since:
        0-6-0

      • getStringList

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getStringList(java.lang.String name)
        Retrieves a list of strings that has been previously stored into options by setStringList(). If no value was found for name, an empty list is returned.
        Parameters:
        name - String name of the list
        Returns:
        List a list of retrieved String values (may be empty)
        Since:
        0-6-0

      • getStoreTime

        public static long getStoreTime()
        Returns the STORETIME value from this option set's METADATA.
        Returns:
        long time in milliseconds or 0 if undefined
